item.title: flanking
item.description: when something has an enemy on opposite sides those enamels it has a -2 to all defensive actions.o = the creature. x = an enemy x o x x o x x x o x x x o x as the enemy are not on opposite sides x o x the enemy on the right has a melee range great enough

item.title: combat
item.description: should ivolve a flow ofpositioning buffing attacking targeting defending is this enough? that puts 2 things done on ur turn and one on others bnut having 3 actions means you have to chose between 2 subliminal options leaves me with options: decrease the number of actions to 2 means that move -> attack will without extra work be the default thing to do and possibly the best thing to do why not decrease 1 will slow down the resolution of combat although making everyones turns come around more quickly removes the abilty for 2s actions exept for multi turn stuff whitch frankly is more relistic chould make it a little harder to decide what to do with your 1s increase complication to combat so that you will need another action for something is it bad that they have an extra seccond outside of the 1 they need for moving it lets players have a choice leaving at 3s is a little unrealisic as the flow of combat whould 100% be on a 1 seccond basis in reality dose that matter at all? seems non consiqentual i think this is what i want todo i need to instivise moving as a stragetic thing i chould do this by adding some kinda rush or charge basic action of if you move towards someone (idk 3m) it adds to damage and to hit but decreases your defenses for the rest of the round flanking +something to hit if the creature has an enamy on 2 opposite sides

item.title: talents
item.description:
trait increase(5)#repeatable #standalone increase one of your traits by +1 up to a maximum of 5 more then your species starting value. skill increase (3)
#repeatable #standalone increase one of your skills by +1 up to a maximum of +5 before trait bonus. SHP increase (5)
#repeatable #standalone increase your soft hit-points by one. you may take this talent up to 10 times.

item.title: trait increase(5)
item.description: #repeatable #standalone increase one of your traits by +1 up to a maximum of 5 more then your species starting value.

item.title: skill increase (3)
item.description: #repeatable #standalone increase one of your skills by +1 up to a maximum of +5 before trait bonus.

item.title: ZZ- notes
item.description:
block docent work with rolling to attack -2 to subsecent attacks really annoying
#increasing-cost is to punising

item.title: home
item.description:
hi there:)sorry but no consistency outside of your character ideas exists, so your builds and make ups will completely change very frequently no races or species yet, feel free to add any for flavor but i havent written the macanics yet. thus all traits start at -1.
to make a character you need to pick talents they will influence your skills, traits and hp you have 100 points to use. hp starts at 10. you get to pick 2 items from:
dagger (dexterity)
rapier (dexterity)
short sword
long sword
bow (dexterity)
shield
armour
when you enter you roll speed (dexterity) to decide turn orderp. you have 3 actions and can use any of these with their corresponding cost:
move(1a)
raise shield(2a)
take cover(1a)
attack(1a) when you are attacked you can do one of the following
dodge
block
parry

item.title: parry
item.description: you attempt to deflect a attack targeting you. you make an attack roll with a weapon you are holding witch has the #parrying propertyif you roll over the attack of the attack it is deflected and you take none.if you roll over half the the attack it is partially deflected and the attacks damage is halved. for every parry after your last turn. you take a -5 penalty

item.title: block
item.description: you use an item to block an attack. you must make a td 10 speed (dexterity) testif that succeeds then the item takes the damage instead of you.

item.title: move(1a)
item.description: move up to your speed (dexterity) meters

item.title: initiative
item.description:
when the gm calls for an initiative roll it is to determine turn order this is a speed (dexterity) test initiative is made up of rounds witch everyone will take in the turn ordera turn consists of 3 actions. almost everything you do will be an action, moving, attacking, drawing a new weapon etc.when there are opponents on 2 sides of a creature attacks agenst the creature have a +2 bonus the basic actions are as follows:
attack(1a)
take cover(1a)
move(1a) when you are attacked you may:
parry
dodge
block

item.title: raise shield(2a)
item.description: you raise your shield gaining the benefits of take cover(1a) and auto succeeded block checks using it

item.title: traits
item.description:
intelligence
charisma
dexterity
strength

item.title: skills
item.description:
tea skill is what you roll when you need todo something, the skills in this game are:all skills are made up of a trait bonus and their own bonus, you add them together to get your modifier when rolling that skill.a trait bonus is the modifier the relevant trait. all skills are laid out like this: skill(trait). you should add your trait bonus to your skill bonus it is independent from skill bonus eg: skill bonus + trait bonus = skill modifier. you add your trait bonus if it is negative. use weapon skills trait bonus is decided by the particular weapon being used thus the skills have no written trait. these are all the skills that you may roll at some point during your adventure.
power (strength)
fortitude (strength)
awareness (intelligence)
inspect (intelligence)
speed (dexterity)
stunt (dexterity)
hide (dexterity)
diplomacy (charisma)
intimidate (charisma)
disguise (charisma)
dodge (dexterity)use weapon skills use weapon: bow use weapon: long-sword use weapon: short-sword use weapon: sling use weapon: fencing use weapon: whip etcthese are up to gm and can be trained in session but topics the person knows egknowledge: global knowledge: monsters knowledge: local(doom river) knowledge: local(mothers nest) knowledge: local(west burrow)a craft: forge craft: alchemy craft: knitting

item.title: take cover(1a)
item.description: if there is something to take cover behind you may take cover. when behind cover attacks ageist you form the direction of the cover take a -3 penalty

item.title: crafting
item.description: wood craft: forge craft: alchemy craft: knitting to craft something you use materials these materials will have a relivent craft skill(s) which can be used to turn them into an item.you can cast items with metal casting kit

item.description: 3d43 head 4 head 5 arm (1d2 L-R) 6 body 7 body 8 body 9 body 10 legs (1d2 L-R) 11 feat (1d2 L-R) 12 hands (1d2 L-R)3 damage resistance. targeting penalty -5. damage* 4. wound value 1/2 attack penalty +0damage* 0.5. targeting penalty -3 .wound value 1/4damage* 0.5. targeting penalty -4 .wound value 1/5

item.title: attack(1a)
item.description: you make an attack with a wepon.subsequent attacks on the same turn take a -5 penalty for every attack after the first.

item.title: damage
item.description: there are 4 main types of body parts limbs (eg. legs and arms) connecting partsextremities (eg. hands and feet)vitals (eg. chest and head) the locations that without they whould preishcrits (eg. groin, ears and eyes) stratigicly usefull locations that dont do as much direct damage but give a negative effect the target
